title: What are key considerations in starting a technology services business? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1. Positioning matters, especially in services industry. And positioning is directly proportional to your focus. It's always better to write down top 1,2 or 3 focus areas to avoid an embarrassment later on. For Example: I'm a Football player sounds good but doesn't reflect you core capability. I'm a Goalkeeper or Striker or defender makes more sense and helps you in lucid positioning. 2. Do your homework before going in a class room. Make sure to have a registered business entity, website, and a cross functional team to justify your services offerings. 3. Reflect your maturity through your own platform. That's the starting point for client to judge you. Make sure your website has a nice design to reflect your designing capability, is strategically aligned to reflect your strategic skills and so on. 4. Always have an outside adviser/mentor/consultant to get a neutral feedback of your idea, plan etc. Every startup must possess a Devil's Advocate to see it's model, idea etc getting challenged. That's when you'll actually sit down and think and realise the evolution of new tactics. 5. Define and design your Business/Revenue model early on. 6. Define your target market or niche and take a focused approach rather than doing anything to target everything. 7. Last but not the least, be flexible and adaptable in whatever you do. Entrepreneurship is a journey to Learn-Unlearn and Relearn the things. Thank You.Sushant Bharti (www.366pi.com)

Technology played a key role in the growth of commerce and trade around  the world. It is true that we have been doing business since time  immemorial, long before there were computers; starting from the simple  concept of barter trade when the concept of a currency was not yet  introduced but trade and commerce was still slow up until the point when  the computer revolution changed everything. Almost all businesses are  dependent on technology on all levels from research and development,  production and all the way to delivery. Small to large scale enterprises  depend on computers to help them with their business needs ranging from  Point of Sales systems, information management systems capable of  handling all kinds of information such as employee profile, client  profile, accounting and tracking, automation systems for use in large  scale production of commodities, package sorting, assembly lines, all  the way to marketing and communications. It doesn’t end there, all these  commodities also need to be transported by sea, land, and air. Just to  transport your commodities by land already requires the use of multiple  systems to allow for fast, efficient and safe transportation of  commodities.
